modules.description: This module encodes audio data into a native FLAC file using either a provided Unix file descriptor or a file path. It works with FLAC encoder parameters, metadata comments, and seekable file descriptors to produce valid FLAC files on disk. Concrete use cases include saving raw audio streams to compressed FLAC files and embedding metadata like artist or album information during encoding.

This module decodes FLAC audio from local files using file descriptors or file paths. It provides handlers that manage decoding state, including file descriptors, decoder instances, stream info, and metadata. Use it to process FLAC files directly, such as in audio playback or file conversion tools.

This module decodes FLAC audio streams by processing frames and extracting metadata, working with raw byte input and producing floating-point audio samples. It handles FLAC data through decoder state transitions, supporting operations like seeking, flushing, and resetting the stream. Use it to implement FLAC playback, audio analysis, or conversion to other formats like WAV using the provided sample conversion function.

This module encodes audio data into the FLAC format using configuration parameters like sample rate, bit depth, and compression level. It operates on floating-point audio buffers and supports metadata tagging through Vorbis comments with validation functions for keys and values. Concrete use cases include converting raw PCM audio to compressed FLAC streams and embedding structured metadata during encoding.

This module provides FLAC decoding and encoding capabilities with precise handling of audio streams. The decoder processes FLAC frames into floating-point samples, supporting operations like seeking and stream resetting, ideal for playback or audio conversion. The encoder compresses PCM audio into FLAC with configurable metadata tagging, suitable for creating FLAC files with embedded track information.
